On the Tuesday edition of Breitbart News Daily, broadcast live on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 6AM to 9AM EST, host and Breitbart News Executive Chairman Stephen K. Bannon will continue the discussion of the massacre at an Orlando gay nightclub by a gunman who pledged his allegiance to the Islamic State.
Bannon will be joined by decorated Army veteran and Republican Congressional candidate Brian Mast, who is running for Congress in Florida’s 18th district where the Orlando shooting took place.

SiriusXM Vice President for news and talk Dave Gorab called the show “the conservative news show of record.”

Follow Breitbart News on Twitter for live updates during the show.
Rep. Brian Babin (R-TX) will discuss the Orlando massacre and a bill he introduced to put pressure on foreign countries that do not take back their criminal aliens.
Mast, a former Army staff sergeant and explosive specialist, lost both his legs in Afghanistan while serving with forces from the Joint Special Operations Command.
Live from London, Rome, and Jerusalem, Breitbart correspondents will provide updates on the latest international news.
Breitbart Tech Editor Milo Yiannopoulos will weigh in on Trump’s appeal to the gay community in his speech on Monday.
We’ll also hear from former Navy SEAL and CEO of Blackwater Erik Prince about the threat of radical Islam.
Breitbart News Daily is the first live conservative radio enterprise to air seven days a week.
Listeners may call into the show at: 866-957-2874.
